https://prez.dev/description.@value: The subject is an instance of a class.

An idea or notion; a unit of thought

A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The collection, preparation, petrographic description, and approximate dating of tephra. The technique uses discrete layers of tephra (volcanic ash from a single eruption) to create a chronological framework in which paleoenvironmental or archeological records can be placed. The premise of the technique is that each volcanic event produces ash with a unique chemical 'fingerprint' that allows the deposit to be identified across the area affected by fallout. Thus, once the volcanic event has been independently dated, the tephra horizon will act as time marker (as such it is a variant of the basic geological technique of stratigraphy).

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Definition adapted from Wikipedia and Glossary of geology (5th edition revised; Neuendorf et al., 2011).
